input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: HPSMActor.

The items for the adapter request. This should be an XML document with a root element named "items" having multiple child "item" elements, which should contain the data necessary to execute the specific request.
Update Installed Software
This wrapper updates 'Installed Software'
Sample Item Xml:
<items> <item> <operation-name>update-installed-software</operation-name> <model> <keys> <license-number> <value>license number</value> <type>String</type> </license-number> <installed-on-c-i> <value>installed on c i</value> <type>String</type> </installed-on-c-i> <application-name> <value>application name</value> <type>String</type> </application-name>
</keys> <instance>
<application-name> <value>application name</value> <type>String</type> </application-name>
<license-number> <value>license number</value> <type>String</type> </license-number> <directory> <value>directory-updated</value> <type>String</type> </directory> <description> <value>description</value> <type>String</type> </description> <version> <value>version</value> <type>String</type> </version> <installation-date> <value>2008.11.01 08:00:00</value> <type>DateTime</type> </installation-date> <installed-by> <value>installed by</value> <type>String</type> </installed-by> <installed-on-c-i> <value>installed on c i</value> <type>String</type> </installed-on-c-i> <suite-component> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </suite-component> <is-authorized> <value>true</value> <type>Boolean</type> </is-authorized> <status> <value>status</value> <type>String</type> </status> <serial-number> <value>serial number</value> <type>String</type> </serial-number> </instance> </model> </item> </items>
Elements’ Description:
Update Process takes place as follows:-
The record is fetched by the information provided in the <keys> element.
Once the record is found, the fields are updated by the information provided in <instance> element. i.e., the respective fields of located record are replaced by the elements’ values that are provided in <instance> element.
NOTE: While locating a record, complete matching of key is required. This means if you give key value to be “abc” and there is a record in the application repository which has key element as “abc123” then this record will not be located for the update.
Modification/Update in located record is done in following manner-
Suppose a random element exists with name <random-element> which has an 'fieldValue1' as its value. i.e. on retrieving, we'll get.
<instance> ... ...
<random-element> <value>fieldValue1</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> ... ... </instance>
See following cases of updation-
Case-1: <instance> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide even the element <random-element> Result: the field is not updated.
Case-2: <instance> <random-element> <value></value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we don't provide anything inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field gets None, i.e. not updated.
Case-3: <instance> <random-element> <value> </value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide an space character " " (or more contiguous space characters, like " ") inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the field gets updated, and the field <random-elements> is set to blank ""(compare with space character " ".)
Case-4: <instance> <random-element> <value>fieldValue2</value> <type>fieldType<type> </random-element> </instance>
i.e., we provide "fieldValue2" inside <value> element (child of element <random-element>.) Result: the value "fieldValue2" is set to field of <random-element>.
NOTE: One can update the key elements too. Required elements cannot be set to blank.
Complete Elements’ Description:
item [Required]: This is a child of <items>. This <item> tag can be multiple times to support "multiple items support".
operation-name [Required]: This is used to specify the operation that needs to be performed.
Valid values: update-installed-software
model[Required]: It is the parent tag for containing all other tags.
keys [Required]: used as a unique identifier of the records by the application.
instance [Required] : It can have several child elements. The children of this element describe fields of a record.
application-name[Optional]: The name of the application.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Application Name
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
Note: this tag is required as a child of <keys> and optional as a child of <instance>. We provide it as a child of <keys> tag to locate the 'Installed Software' entry to be updated. The value of this tag as a child of <instance> is the new desired value of this tag.
license-number [Optional]: the license number.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > License ID
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
Note: we provide this tag in two ways: as a child of <keys> tag and as a child of <instance> tag. In both cases it's optional tag. We provide it as a child of <keys> when tags <application-name> & <installed-on-c-i> together are not able to uniquely locate the 'Installed Software' entry to be updated. The value of this tag as a child of <instance> is the new desired value of it.
installed-on-c-i [Optional]: configuration item where software is installed.
Name of this element in the application: Installed Computer System > Installed System
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
Note: this tag is required as a child of <keys> and optional as a child of <instance>. We provide it as a child of <keys> tag to locate the 'Installed Software' entry to be updated. The value of this tag as a child of <instance> is the new desired value of this tag.
directory[Optional]: the directory.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Installed Directory
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
description [Optional]: The description field.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Description
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
version [Optional]: the version information.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Version
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
installation-date [Optional] : The date of installation.
Name of this element in the application: Installed Computer System > Installation Date
Valid Values: Any input in DateTime (i.e., YYYY.MM.DD hh:mm:ss) fomat.
Default Value: None.
installed-by [Optional]: Installing person.
Name of this element in the application: Installed Computer System > Installed By
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
suite-component [Optional] :
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > "Suite Component?"
Valid Values: true, false.
Default Value: None.
is-authorized [Optional]: This is used to specify if software is authorized.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > "Authorized?"
Valid Values: true, false.
Default Value: None.
status [Optional]: status of the software.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Status
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.
serial-number [Optional]: the serial number for the software.
Name of this element in the application: Application Information > Serial No.
Valid Values: Any string.
Default Value: None.

Provide username/password in form of xml.
This input parameter is required when the user wants to override the default values for username and password provided in the adapter configuration. This is required for cases where an operation cannot be executed with the default username/password provided in the adapter configuration and only user with special permissions can execute the operation. Examples of such operations can be - 'approve-change', 'deny-change', 'close-change', 'approve-task'
Sample XML Format:
<connection-parameters> <alternate-username>USERNAME</alternate-username> <alternate-password>PASSWORD</alternate-password> </connection-parameters>

output.description: The adapter response containing the results.

documentation.description:
Update Installed Software
This wrapper updates Installed Software record via the application. The application saves this record into its repository which can later be used.
